title: Alarm Clock

verbs: To make a clicking noise similar to the movement of the hands in an analog clock.
Make a clicking or ticking sound
Fill with apprehension or alarm; cause to be unpleasantly surprised
Warn or arouse to a sense of danger or call to a state of preparedness
To measure or record the time, duration, or rate of.
Measure the time or duration of an event or action or the person who performs an action in a certain period of time
To measure the amount of time an object takes to complete a course (e.g., "to clock a race car").
nouns: Time is the fourth dimension and a measure in which events can be ordered from the past through the present into the future, and also the measure of durations of events and the intervals between them.
Inevitable passing of events.
Dimension in which events can be ordered from the past through the present into the future
Time is a concept referring to the perceived flow of actions and events from the past to future, or to its measurement.
A period of time in which a given event is valid. The valid time interval includes the valid start time, and all moments of time up to, but not including the valid end time.
The inevitable progression into the future with the passing of present events into the past.
The dimension of the physical universe which, at a given place, orders the sequence of events.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past
Type of clock.
A clock with an alarm that can be set to sound at a determined time.
A button on an alarm clock which, when pressed, silences the alarm temporarily, granting a few more minutes of sleep before the alarm sounds again.
A clock that wakes a sleeper at some preset time
An alert that is set by the user to be activated at a particular time.
An alarm clock is a clock that is designed to make a sound, or some other signal, at a specific time.
Clock that can be set to ring at a given time of the day.
A clock is an instrument to indicate, keep, and co-ordinate time.
A timepiece that shows the time of day
An instrument used to measure or keep track of time.
Instrument that tells the time
Instrument to measure or keep track of time.
An instrument used to measure or keep track of time; a non-portable timepiece.

description:
A timepiece set in advance to startle a person awake at the designated time with its two bells. That is, before hitting snooze. Appearance varies across platforms, but depicted as a classic, wind-up, bedside alarm clock, often red in color.

May be used for various content concerning alarms, alerts, sleeping, waking, and time more generally.
apple_vendor_description: The alarm clock emoji on Apple devices presents a classic analog design, rendered with Apple's signature glossy 3D shading and soft rounded edges. Its face is a crisp white with bold, black numerals and hands, highlighted by realistic lighting that emphasizes its metallic casing.  This emoji, often depicted with hands pointing to an early hour, signifies waking up, reminders, or the passage of time, a familiar sight in Apple's vibrant digital interface.
